8. Recurrent hallucinogen use in situations in which it is physi-
cally hazardous (e.g., driving an automobile or operating a
machine when impaired by the hallucinogen).
9. Hallucinogen use is continued despite knowledge of having
a persistent or recurrent physical or psychological problem
that is likely to have been caused or exacerbated by the hal-
lucinogen.
10. Tolerance, as defined by either of the following:
a. A need for markedly increased amounts of the hallucino-
gen to achieve intoxication or desired effect.
b. A markedly diminished effect with continued use of the
same amount of the hallucinogen.
Note: Withdrawal symptoms and signs are not established for
hallucinogens, and so this criterion does not apply.

strong desire or urge to use the hallucinogen,” may be met).
